properties.name: Agra
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon Well, of course.

properties.name: Ahmedabad: Home #2!
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A surprise favorite on our travels, with a cool historic center and definitely UN-touristy, friendly charm. Its less hectic, better preserved indigenous residential neighborhoods has me returning in a rush. Ahmedabad becomes home February 9...

properties.name: Bangalore
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon An IT-booming city unfortunately without much to do (sorry, Bangalore) - but at least we were there for some holiday lights?

properties.name: Chennai
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A refreshingly southern Indian city - even as one of India\'s largest urban centers, it exudes a welcoming sense of southern relaxation. It\'s also an unusual Christian gem in a largely Hindu-dominated India: San Thome Basilica proudly rests over the tomb of Saint Thomas.

properties.name: Delhi: My First (Unruly) Home
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon  My first official address in India: B-28 Defence Colony. Always to have a strange soft spot in my heart? (Or else my bladder - whenever I pee my pants laughing at the thought of my first appalled conversation with Grandma-Next-Door through the gap in the wall.)

properties.name: Delhi: My First (Unruly) Home
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon

properties.name: Haridwar
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A sacred Hindu city, where the River Ganga first spreads out into the fertile plains. Famous for the colorful activity, ritual bathing, and floating-candlelit prayers on its river ghat.

properties.name: Jaipur
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon The infamous "Pink City" (or salmon-colored city, whatever), and the third stop on the tourist-laden Golden Triangle (Delhi-Agra-Jaipur). Still a classic Rajasthani city, but it\'s also seen better days.

properties.name: Jaisalmer
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon Rajasthan\'s most distant gem: a city of striking golden sandstone, and a famous fort that charmingly looks a bit like a mammoth sandcastle.

properties.name: Jodhpur
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon The Blue City - my FAVORITE city! The fort was beautiful - the small welcoming bright-blue streets even more so. And remarkably, Jodhpur had not yet lost its quiet friendly personality to tourism (a pretty rare feat now in the popular cities of Rajasthan).

properties.name: Kochi
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A gorgeous Keralan delight - from the beautifully surreal Dutch colonial buildings, to the cool Chinese fishing nets, to our trip to the BACKWATERS!

properties.name: Madurai
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A famous temple city - whose famous temples are currently covered for a once-every-12-years paint job. Ah well, at least we had a Fulbright friend to visit there.

properties.name: Mamallapuram
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A very small, fun beach town - and within distance of amazing ancient rockcut temples.

properties.name: Mysore
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A fun daytrip from Bangalore, complete with amazing, sprawling palace grounds and a colorful market (literally - many vendors sell \'colors,\' powders used for pavement decorations in front of home thresholds).

properties.name: Pondicherry
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon A very odd little piece of Indian-flavored France on the Bay of Bengal coast.

properties.name: Rishikesh
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon One of the most peaceful spots I\'ve found in India - even despite its overwhelming hippy-yoga-tourist popularity, thanks to one single totally random historical event putting it on the map: a visit by the Beatles.

properties.name: Shimla
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon My first break from the smoggy hecticness of Delhi - a peaceful hill-station in the Himalayan foothills - and the capital of Himachal Pradesh.

properties.name: Udaipur
properties.description: Posted by Cailinshannon Rajasthan\'s famous lake city, complete with idyllic white palace resting surreally right in the midst of the water.
